response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Check if a Number is a Power of Two\", \"description\": \"A power of two is an integer that can be expressed as 2^k for some non-negative integer k. Write a function `is_power_of_two` that checks whether a given integer is a power of two.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef is_power_of_two(n: int) -> bool:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `n` (int): An integer that may be positive, negative, or zero.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns `True` if the input integer is a power of two, `False` otherwise.\\n\", \"code\": \"def is_power_of_two(n: int) -> bool:\\n    if n <= 0:\\n        return False\\n    while n % 2 == 0:\\n        n = n // 2\\n    return n == 1\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert is_power_of_two(16) == True\", \"assert is_power_of_two(15) == False\", \"assert is_power_of_two(-8) == True\", \"assert is_power_of_two(0) == False\"] }"
